lines.text: Wouldn't it be great if wars could be fought just by the assholes who started them?

[to the Postman]
You're a godsend. A savior!
No, I'm... I'm just the Postman.
You're nothing but a drifter who found a bag of mail.
I know you. You're... famous.
I was once... sorta.
[Clutching a spoon as a weapon]
Don't make me use this.
I was at the Battle of Georgetown; I watched the White House burn to the ground!
Great men were made by other great men. Patton had Rommel, Grant had Lee, I get stuck with you.

Once more into the breach, my friends, once more. We'll close the wall with our dead. In peace, nothing so becomes a man as modesty and humility, but when the blast of war blows in our ears, then imitate the action of the tiger, summon up the blood, disguise fair nature with rage and lend the eye a terrible aspect.
The President's name... is Richard Starkey!
You're no general. You're not even a good painter.
You made Mrs. March feel like she could see again. You made Ford believe he was part of something. You give out hope like it was candy in your pocket.
It takes one postman to make someone else a postman.
Sorta like vampires, huh?
Uh... Strangers... I hate this. Do they want to share what they got or take what you got? Do you say 'hi' or do you blow them away?
[the Postman is performing Shakespeare]
It's a tale told by...

[prompting him]
An idiot.
...by a moron! Full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
U.S. Mail... Restored United States... Do these people really believe that shit?
[Hours after The Postman arrived in town, a woman has asked to have his child]
It's gotta be the uniform.

I know what your problem is. Do you know why you won't fight? Because you have nothing to fight for! You don't care about anything! You don't value anything! You don't believe in anything! That's what makes me better!
There is only one penalty. Death.

[to The Postman]
I have a feeling about you. I know you'll do what's right.
I heard of you, man. *You're* famous!
Yeah, I guess I am.
When I was a kid, we all wore our hats backwards. We thought it was cool.
Great men were made by other great men. Patton had Rommel. Grant had Lee!
I tried to be an actor when I was young. I wasn't a good actor, but now after seeing you at least I can die knowing I wasn't the worst one.
How much did you pay to get in, Larry? So bite me!
You see the reason you don't want to die for anything is because you have nothing to die for. That's the difference between you and me. You don't believe in anything.
I believe in the United States.

[shivering in the postal van, sees a skeleton]
Hi, how you doing?
[end of the movie; introducing The Postman to her baby]
This is your daughter... her name is Hope.
The General is a great man!

[incredulous]
The General is a fucking lunatic!

[while talking with the Postman]
I was an aerospace engineer. I helped design the Galileo space station. I dream it's orbiting Earth forever, with a dozen human skeletons all grinning at each other. Laughing at us down here.
how much mail can a dead Postman deliver?
